intro.description: Welcome to the TiShadow tutorial to run tests. Let's get started!

item.title: Appify your project
item.description:
First you have to 'appify' the project you want to test, which will create a new app that is basically the same but with the TiShadow libraries included.
1. Select the app you want to appify, right-click it and select New>TiShadow Appify
2. Enter the name of the appified project and select location of the project you want to test (base project).
3. Select the location where the appified app will be created (output folder) if you don't want the default location.
4. Enter the port and host in which the TiShadow server will run.
5. Click Finish.

item.title: Start the TiShadow server
item.description:
Then, you need to start the TiShadow server in order to access its services. So, do the following:
1. Right-click on the appified project that you just created, Run As, Run TiShadow Server.

item.title: Run the appified project
item.description:
After that, you need to run the appified project on a device or emulator.
Example: On Genymotion:
1. Open Genymotion.
2. Start your preferred device.
3. Start the appified project.

item.title: Deploy
item.description:
Perform any code change you need and deploy into the appified app. To do this, you have two options:
1. Right click on the appified project that you just created, Run As.. Run TiShadow Tests. 2. Click on the "TiShadow Deploy" menu button on the Titanium/Eclipse toolbar.

item.title: Run the tests
item.description:
Finally, to run the tests you have two options:
1. Right click on the appified project that you just created, Run As>Run TiShadow Tests. 2. Select the project and click on the "Run TiShadow Tests" menu button on the Titanium/Eclipse toolbar.
